column4: how do i fix this:  i keep getting this error when i run Update Manager:  W:Failed to fetch http://ppa.launchpad.net/ubuntu-desktop/gnome3-builds/ubuntu/dists/natty/main/binary-i386/Packages  404  Not Found
, E:Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.
Remove the repository, it looks like the PPA was deleted.
If you're trying to share a paste with us, you need to give us the url of the page that came up after you pressed the button on http://paste.ubuntu.com
i think that i should add more information to that and try again. wait one, please.
I think you mentioned earlier that you had installed the gnome3 ppa? If so, that is unsupported, we don't know what changes and/or problems that will cause for you.
this problem started when i downloaded 11.04, and i didn't change the gnome3 ppa until yesterday. this problem predates that.
and i've just discovered that now i can't unlock ANY keys
did you try any of these fixes before you installed the ppa?
i also discovered, and should have added this to the longer post, that even if i unlock a key, when i restart my machine, it's locked again
I don't have a desktop install here to test along with you, but I'd make sure that your gnome config files in your home directory are all owned by you.
do you have a link to how i'd do that, or can you tell me how?
Sorry, got sidetracked with real work on my end.  Did you figure things out?
BluesKaj: both of you stop it.
no change. i still get 3 login prompts.
